content:
As an AI language model, I don't have access to the latest features of Reference.com community. However, based on previous knowledge here is how the community features on Reference.com work:

User-generated content: Reference.com allows users to create and maintain content on its platform. Users can contribute to different categories of content such as definitions, translations, and thesaurus entries. Users create and submit their content through an interface that checks for quality, accuracy, and appropriateness. Once approved, the content gets published on the site, and the user gets credited as an author.

Forums: Reference.com has a forum section that allows users to interact, exchange information, and seek answers to their questions. Users can post topics, queries, or comments on different sections of the site. Other users can then respond to these posts by leaving their comments, opinions, or suggestions. The forum section provides an opportunity for users to communicate and share ideas on various topics, ranging from science, geography, history, among others.

The community features on Reference.com provide an opportunity for users to contribute to the creation of knowledge and share their expertise with others. The user-generated content and forums help to promote collaboration, engagement, and the exchange of knowledge.
